eoss.main
Class DocumentManager

java.lang.Object
  eoss.main.DocumentManager

public class DocumentManager
extends java.lang.Object

The DocumentManager is responsible for managing the various files that are being edited. It manages opening and saving files, in addition to keeping track of the file currently being edited. The file currently being edited is only accessible through delegates in the DocumentManager.

Author:
julianboilen

Method Detail

open

public java.lang.String open(java.io.File file)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Opens a file using the given validator and makes it the active file. If the given File object cannot be read or does not exist, a new buffer is created using the File object with the assumption that it will be saved at the location given by File in the future.

Parameters:
validator - Object to validate the file for correctness
file - The file to be opened
Throws:
java.io.IOException

save

public void save(java.lang.String text)
          throws java.io.IOException
Saves the FileBuffer currently being edited to whatever File it already has stored.

Parameters:
text - The updated text of the file
Throws:
java.io.IOException

save

public void save(java.io.File f,
                 java.lang.String text)
          throws java.io.IOException
Saves the FileBuffer currently being edited to the given File. This is conceptually equivalent to calling a "save as" method. It changes the file stored in the FileBuffer to this new file and marks it as being saved.

Parameters:
f - destination file
text - updated text of the file
Throws:
java.io.IOException

isSaved

public boolean isSaved()
Allows the client to check whether the buffer which is currently being edited is saved. As soon as a change is made to a document, this method will return false.

Returns:
true if the buffer is saved, false otherwise.

close

public void close(FileBuffer buffer)
           throws BufferNotOpenException
TODO: This method should be removed. A client should only be able to modify a currently active buffer. -- Josaphat Remove a buffer from being managed.

Parameters:
buffer -
Throws:
BufferNotOpenException

close

public void close()
Closes the active buffer. If this is the last buffer, no active buffer will be set until open() is called. If there are more buffers, the last buffer in the array will be the new active buffer.

copy

public void copy(int start,
                 int end)
The copy method takes the take text in the current buffer between index_low and index_high and places it into a copy buffer.
